# The `ARMParallelDSP.cpp` File Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

## Description {#details}

Armv6 introduced instructions to perform 32-bit SIMD operations.

The purpose of this pass is do some IR pattern matching to create ACLE DSP intrinsics, which map on these 32-bit SIMD operations. This pass runs only when unaligned accesses is supported/enabled.

<SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// MaxBitwidth: the maximum supported bitwidth of the elements in the DSP</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instructions, which is set to 16 So here we should collect all i8 and i16</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// narrow operations.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// TODO: we currently only collect i16, and will support i8 later, so that&#39;s</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// why we check that types are equal to MaxBitWidth, and not &lt;= MaxBitWidth.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">unsigned</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> MaxBitW</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">id</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">th&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="422"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="423"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Search recursively back through the operands to find a tree of values that</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="424"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// form a multiply-accumulate chain. The search records the Add and Mul</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="425"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// instructions that form the reduction and allows us to find a single value</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="426"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// to be used as the initial input to the accumlator.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="427"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ARMParallelDSP::Search(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;V, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">BasicBlock</a> &#42;BB, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/transforms/lib/transforms/scalar/loopstrengthreduce-cpp/#a175f1f53cc9c3619505ffbd13aca087f">Reduction</a> &amp;R) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="428"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If we find a non-instruction, try to use it as the initial accumulator</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="429"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// value. This may have already been found during the search in which case</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="472"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="473"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="474"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The pass needs to identify integer add/sub reductions of 16-bit vector</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="475"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// multiplications.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="476"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// To use SMLAD:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="477"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// 1) we first need to find integer add then look for this pattern:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="478"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="479"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// acc0 = ...</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ld0 = load i16</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00481" /><CodeLine lineNumber="481"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// sext0 = sext i16 %ld0 to i32</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00482" /><CodeLine lineNumber="482"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ld1 = load i16</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00483" /><CodeLine lineNumber="483"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// sext1 = sext i16 %ld1 to i32</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00484" /><CodeLine lineNumber="484"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// mul0 = mul %sext0, %sext1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00485" /><CodeLine lineNumber="485"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ld2 = load i16</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00486" /><CodeLine lineNumber="486"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// sext2 = sext i16 %ld2 to i32</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="487"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ld3 = load i16</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00488" /><CodeLine lineNumber="488"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// sext3 = sext i16 %ld3 to i32</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00489" /><CodeLine lineNumber="489"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// mul1 = mul i32 %sext2, %sext3</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00490" /><CodeLine lineNumber="490"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// add0 = add i32 %mul0, %acc0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00491" /><CodeLine lineNumber="491"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// acc1 = add i32 %add0, %mul1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00492" /><CodeLine lineNumber="492"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00493" /><CodeLine lineNumber="493"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Which can be selected to:</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00494" /><CodeLine lineNumber="494"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00495" /><CodeLine lineNumber="495"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ldr r0</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00496" /><CodeLine lineNumber="496"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// ldr r1</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00497" /><CodeLine lineNumber="497"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// smlad r2, r0, r1, r2</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00498" /><CodeLine lineNumber="498"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00499" /><CodeLine lineNumber="499"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If constants are used instead of loads, these will need to be hoisted</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00500" /><CodeLine lineNumber="500"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// out and into a register.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00501" /><CodeLine lineNumber="501"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00502" /><CodeLine lineNumber="502"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If loop invariants are used instead of loads, these need to be packed</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00503" /><CodeLine lineNumber="503"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// before the loop begins.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00504" /><CodeLine lineNumber="504"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00505" /><CodeLine lineNumber="505"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> ARMParallelDSP::MatchSMLAD(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/function">Function</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
